page.title: 06AN EASSIE FARMWORKER'S LIFE
page.content: Farmworkers in the Eassie area start work at 7.30 each morning. They work till 12 noon, when they get an hour for lunch. Work continues till 5p.m.. At busy times such as seed-time and harvest, they work long hours of overtime to get the work completed on time. In winter-time when there is not a lot of outside work to do, the men are busy getting the machinery ready for the next season. They also make potato boxes, mend fences and feed the cattle which are indoors for the winter. The men get two weeks holidays when the spring planting is over and three weeks later in the year. All our land workers live on the farms in tied cottages.
